results.title: Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Methylene_Blue @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008751 @@@Methylthioninium chloride@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Methylene_Blue @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008751 @@@methylene blue@@@): Four case reports reported an association with improvement in haemodynamics following administration of @CHEMICAL_Methylene_Blue @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008751 @@@methylene blue@@@ but in the setting of co-ingestion with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@.Intravenous @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ emulsion therapy: There was variable response to intravenous @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ emulsion therapy reported in 10 case series, 5 animal studies and 21 case reports.

citations.NLM: Rotella JA, Greene SL, Koutsogiannis Z, Graudins A, Hung Leang Y, Kuan K, Baxter H, Bourke E, Wong A. Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review. Clin Toxicol (Phila). 2020 Oct;58(10):943-983. PMID: 32310006
citations.BibTeX: @article{32310006, title={Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review.}, author={Rotella JA and Greene SL and Koutsogiannis Z and Graudins A and Hung Leang Y and Kuan K and Baxter H and Bourke E and Wong A}, journal={Clin Toxicol (Phila)}, volume={58}, number={10}, pages={943-983}}

results.title: Hospital use and costs among patients with nonischemic cardiomyopathy in the first prospective randomized amlodipine survival evaluation study.
results.text_hl: Significantly fewer @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were admitted for unexplained @DISEASE_Heart_Arrest @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@cardiac arrest@@@ (odds ratio, 0.235; P = 0.002) and @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@ventricular arrhythmias@@@ (odds ratio, 0.497; P = 0.004).

citations.NLM: O'Connor CM, Radensky PW, Unger AN, Martin BC. Hospital use and costs among patients with nonischemic cardiomyopathy in the first prospective randomized amlodipine survival evaluation study. Clin Ther. 1999 Jul;21(7):1254-65. PMID: 10463522
citations.BibTeX: @article{10463522, title={Hospital use and costs among patients with nonischemic cardiomyopathy in the first prospective randomized amlodipine survival evaluation study.}, author={O'Connor CM and Radensky PW and Unger AN and Martin BC}, journal={Clin Ther}, volume={21}, number={7}, pages={1254-65}}

results.title: Amlodipine toxicity in children less than 6 years of age: a dose-response analysis using national poison data system data.
results.text_hl: ...BACKGROUND: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ is a long-acting calcium channel blocker capable of producing @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@dysrhythmia@@@ in @DISEASE_Drug_Overdose @DISEASE_MESH:D062787 @@@overdose@@@.

citations.NLM: Benson BE, Spyker DA, Troutman WG, Watson WA, Bakhireva LN. Amlodipine toxicity in children less than 6 years of age: a dose-response analysis using national poison data system data. J Emerg Med. 2010 Aug;39(2):186-93. PMID: 19535212
citations.BibTeX: @article{19535212, title={Amlodipine toxicity in children less than 6 years of age: a dose-response analysis using national poison data system data.}, author={Benson BE and Spyker DA and Troutman WG and Watson WA and Bakhireva LN}, journal={J Emerg Med}, volume={39}, number={2}, pages={186-93}}

results.title: Amlodipine, a long-acting calcium antagonist drug reduces ischemia-induced ventricular conduction delay in pig hearts.
results.text_hl: In the subendocardium, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ decreased only time to onset (-25 +/- 4%, p less than 0.01) within the @DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ zone.

citations.NLM: Rämö MP, Plowden JS, Gabel M, Millard RW, Lathrop DA. Amlodipine, a long-acting calcium antagonist drug reduces ischemia-induced ventricular conduction delay in pig hearts. Am J Cardiol. 1989 Nov 7;64(17):78I-83I. PMID: 2530889

results.title: Ivabradine: new drug. Best avoided in stable angina.
results.text_hl: Severe @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@arrhythmias@@@ were also more frequent with @CHEMICAL_Ivabradine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077550 @@@ivabradine@@@ than with @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (1.3% versus 0.7%) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (0.6% versus 0.2%). (6) @CHEMICAL_Ivabradine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077550 @@@Ivabradine@@@ provokes phosphenes (flashing lights, etc.) in about 17% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ in the short term.

citations.NLM: Ivabradine: new drug. Best avoided in stable angina. Prescrire Int. 2007 Apr;16(88):53-6. PMID: 17458043

results.title: Antiarrhythmic and anti-ischemic properties of calcium-channel antagonists.
results.text_hl: These drugs are extremely useful in the management of @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@cardiac arrhythmias@@@ (particularly @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@supraventricular arrhythmias@@@) and/or @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Apostolakos MJ, Varon ME. Antiarrhythmic and anti-ischemic properties of calcium-channel antagonists. New Horiz. 1996 Feb;4(1):45-57. PMID: 8689275

results.title: Application of calcium channel blockers in the treatment of cardiovascular diseases.
results.text_hl: Actually, the optimal drugs from this group are representatives of the third generation: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_lacidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C060285 @@@lacidipine@@@.

results.title: Arrhythmic cardiac arrest due to isolated coronary artery spasm: long-term outcome of seven resuscitated patients.
results.text_hl: All were habitual cigarette smokers. No @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@arrhythmias@@@ were induced on programmed ventricular stimulation; corrected QT interval (QTc) and corrected JT interval (JTc) dispersion were within normal ranges.
